text: The firelight flickered in her eyes, the air still thick with the scent of wine.
“And you?” I asked quietly. “What would you change?”
She was silent for a long time, simply looking at me—so long that I nearly forgot to breathe.
Her gray-blue eyes seemed glazed with frost. Through the fire’s glow, nothing seemed able to reach her.
“Some questions,” she murmured, “are already too late once spoken.”
She took another slow sip of wine. The motion was calm, but carried a chill that pushed everything else away.
The fireplace popped softly, as if to echo the silence that followed.
